commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: European Observatory on Airport Capacity & Quality#E01111#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1111#Member#C#Task Force on economic impact of unaccomodated demand & environmental variables#Task Force on learning from national strategies on airport capacity#Noise Expert Group#E02809#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2809#Member#C
goals__remit:
The Airport Regions Conference (ARC) is an association of regional and local authorities across Europe with an international airport situated within or near its territory. 
The ARC brings together a wide range of expertise at the interface of air transport and local and regional policies. A common concern is to balance the economic benefits generated by the airports against their environmental impact, notably the effect on the quality of life of local residents. 
ARC works with the European Commissioner for Transport and Cabinet and the EC Directorates for Transport, for the Environment, and for the Regions
relevant_communication:
Projects:  
ANIMA is a research project on aviation noise within Horizon 2020.  
LAirA is a research project on airports accessibility to be fostered through an improvement of public transport services, within INTERREG Central Europe.  
Conferences:  
Surface access conference, Brussels, November 2017 
MEP breakfast meeting on connectivity, December 2017 
MEP breakfast meeting on noise and ANIMA project, March 2018 
Conference on cities, mobility and the future, Gothenburg, April 2018
